page.title: 11STUDY OF LOCAL FARM _ BORTH
page.content: Brynllys farm, Dolybont, takes in the southern part of Borth Bog and is bordered by the River Leri. Farmed organically, it retains the traditional farm buildings although some modern covered yards have been added over the last few years. The stock is mainly cattle _ 70 Guernsey milking cows, 86 young cattle, a few beef cattle and three bulls. There are some 90 breeding ewes, a few pigs and three horses for riding. Of the milk produced, 80% is sold to the local Milk Marketing Board Creamery, 20% is turned into dairy products on the farm _ butter, cream, yoghurts ans soft cheese, sold locally Twelve acres are used for growing vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, leeks, onions, swedes, cauliflower and cabbage _ again sold locally.
